remarks: An upper bound on the partial sums of the ` CNF ` function.  Since each term dominates all previous terms, by induction we can bound the whole sum with any exponent ` A ^o C ` where ` C ` is larger than any exponent ` ( G `` x ) , x e. K ` which has been summed so far. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2015.)  (Revised by AV, 29-Jun-2019.)

cantnfval.h $e |- H = seqom ( ( k e. _V , z e. _V |-> ( ( ( A ^o ( G ` k ) ) .o ( F ` ( G ` k ) ) ) +o z ) ) , (/) ) $.

cantnflt.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. On ) $.
cantnflt.s $e |- ( ph -> ( G " K ) C_ C ) $.
